result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J Owen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of extended supervision are left up to the discretion of the Department of Corrections.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court sets restitution at zero.
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy J Owen in court.  Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court for Timothy J Owen.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 192 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

*Court orders 6 MONTH revocation of drivers license.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Provide a DNA sample.
- All conditions of extended supervision are left up to the discretion of the Department of Corrections.
 
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court sets restitution at zero.
*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights
Jury instructions
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Timothy J Owen not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing. Defendant was transferred to another facility and could not be produced. Case is adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eugene E. Detert in court, defendant Timothy J Owen not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Timothy J Owen in court, appear by video with attorney Eugene E. Detert, appear in person.  Defendant Timothy J Owen in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kayla M.B.

Defendant Timothy J Owen in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Timothy J Owen in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timothy J Owen appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
